00004 /*
00005  *  A convenience routine to set some default values
00006  */
00007 
00008 Lgm_MagModelInfo *Lgm_InitMagInfo( ) {
00009 
00010     Lgm_MagModelInfo  *MagInfo;
00011    
00012     MagInfo = (Lgm_MagModelInfo *) calloc (1, sizeof(*MagInfo));
00013 
00014     MagInfo->InternalModel = LGM_IGRF;
00015 
00016     MagInfo->c     = Lgm_init_ctrans( 0 );
00017     MagInfo->Kp    = 5;
00018     MagInfo->P     = 2.1; // SW pressure in nPa
00019     MagInfo->nFunc = 0;
00020 
00021     MagInfo->B0    = 1.00;   // Should nominally be 1.0 See page 30 of Schultz and Lanzerotti, [1974]
00022     MagInfo->B1    = 0.8100; // See page 30 of Schultz and Lanzerotti, [1974]
00023     MagInfo->B2    = 0.4065; // See page 30 of Schultz and Lanzerotti, [1974]
00024 
00025     MagInfo->SavePoints = 0;
00026     MagInfo->Hmax       = 1.0;
00027 
00028     MagInfo->UseInterpRoutines = TRUE;
00029     Lgm_Set_Open_Limits( MagInfo, -80.0, 30.0, -40.0, 40.0, -40.0, 40.0 );
00030 
00031     MagInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_JumpMethod = LGM_ABSOLUTE_JUMP_METHOD;
00032 
00033     /*
00034      *  Some inits for MagStep
00035      */
00036     MagInfo->Lgm_MagStep_FirstTimeThrough = TRUE;
00037     MagInfo->Lgm_MagStep_eps_old          = -1.0;
00038 
00039 //    gsl_set_error_handler_off(); // Turn off gsl default error handler
00040 
00041 
00042 
00043     /*
00044      * Set some default tolerances
00045      */
00046     MagInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00047     MagInfo->Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-5;
00048 
00049     MagInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsabs = 0.0;
00050     MagInfo->Lgm_LambdaIntegral_Integrator_epsrel = 1e-3;
00051 
00052     MagInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsrel = 0.0;
00053     MagInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsabs = 1e-3;
00054     MagInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator = DQAGS;
00055 
00056     MagInfo->Lgm_Sb_Integrator_epsrel = 0.0;
00057     MagInfo->Lgm_Sb_Integrator_epsabs = 1e-3;
00058     MagInfo->Lgm_Sb_Integrator = DQAGP; // not changeable (yet...)
00059 
00060 
00061     MagInfo->Lgm_FindBmRadius_Tol = 1e-10;
00062     MagInfo->Lgm_FindShellLine_I_Tol = 1e-3;
00063     MagInfo->Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint_Tol = 1e-7;
00064 
00065 
00066 
00067 
00068 
00069     return MagInfo;
00070 
00071 }

00074 
00075 void Lgm_FreeMagInfo( Lgm_MagModelInfo  *Info ) {
00076 
00077     Lgm_free_ctrans( Info->c );
00078     free( Info );
00079 
00080 }
00081 
00082 
00083 
00084 
00085 /*
00086  *  The Lgm_MagModelInfo structure has pointers in it, so simple
00087  *  asignments (e.g. *t = *s) are dangerous. Here we make sure that
00088  *  the target gets an independent copy of the structure.
00089  */
00090 Lgm_MagModelInfo *Lgm_CopyMagInfo( Lgm_MagModelInfo *s ) {
00091 
00092     Lgm_MagModelInfo *t;
00093 
00094 
00095     if ( s == NULL) {
00096         printf("Lgm_CopyMagInfo: Error, source structure is NULL\n");
00097         return;
00098     }
00099 
00100     t = (Lgm_MagModelInfo *)calloc( 1, sizeof(Lgm_MagModelInfo) );
00101 
00102     // memcpy's args are (dest, src, size)
00103     memcpy( t, s, sizeof(Lgm_MagModelInfo) );
00104 
00105 
00106     /*
00107      *  Now, copy the Lgm_CTrans struct properly. 
00108      */
00109     t->c = Lgm_CopyCTrans( s->c );
00110 
00111 
00112     /*
00113      *  Lets also assume that GSL interp stuff should be NULL
00114      */
00115     //t->acc    = (gsl_interp_accel *)NULL;
00116     //t->spline = (gsl_spline *)NULL;
00117 
00118     return( t );
00119 
00120 }
00121

00123 
00124 /*
00125  * Testing...
00126  * This type of model for setting things is more in the style of OO-programming
00127  * Could return error if pointer is NULL???
00128  */
00129 void Lgm_MagModelInfo_Set_Psw( double Psw, Lgm_MagModelInfo *m ) {
00130     m->P = Psw;
00131 }
00132 void Lgm_MagModelInfo_Set_Kp( double Kp, Lgm_MagModelInfo *m ) {
00133     m->Kp = Kp;
00134 }

00141     return;

00153 void Lgm_Set_Open_Limits( Lgm_MagModelInfo *m, double xmin, double xmax, double ymin, double ymax, double zmin, double zmax ){
00154     m->OpenLimit_xMin = xmin;
00155     m->OpenLimit_xMax = xmax;
00156     m->OpenLimit_yMin = ymin;
00157     m->OpenLimit_yMax = ymax;
00158     m->OpenLimit_zMin = zmin;
00159     m->OpenLimit_zMax = zmax;
00160     return;
00161 }
